sourceDesc.p: Created from original research by members of CWRC/CSÉC unless otherwise noted.

div.head: P O I C T O V .
div.p: THis prouince of [Poitou], called in Latin [Piclanis] is detryded into two partes, to wit the [Superior] & [Inferior]. The vpper [Poitou] is that which ſtretcheth eaſt-ward towards the countries of Towrs [and] Berry, the nether [Poitou] is that parte which weſtward extendeth it ſelf to the Ocean ſea.

It is a country frutefull in [Corne] [and] [Cattle] rich in wynes [and] furniſhed with great ſtore of fiſh, And the great aboundance of wyld beaſtes [and] fowle, doth cauſe the delightfull fportes of hunting [and] hauking to bee here much vſed.

The chief citie of this prouince is called [Poititrt], having a notable vni- uerſitie chiefly for ſtudy of the Ciuil law, this citie is of great [antiquirie] as appeereth by the [Theatre], [Aquaduct], [and] [monuments], which are there yet remaining.
